answers.answer: Hell no. Your not the onky one. Im freaking miserable. Im onky 35 weeks but sometimes selfish thoughts go thru my head on ways to get her out of me. I know its not safe but some days i dnt care. Like today. I think she would b just fine if she came now
Thank you! I felt like I was alone... lol

Your definitely not alone. I'm 33+5 and dealing with this pregnancy is hard! I've been fighting to keep my job because they just don't seem to understand how hard pregnacy can be. I've been having selfish thoughts all day. Today I just felt like a couple days in the NICU might not be so bad :(
I can totally relate girl. I'm 34+4 and so ready to have this baby! getting sooo impatient with all the waiting. seems like the closer it gets the slower time is going!!!

Im 34 wks and suddenly feeling a lot of niggles I didn't feel before. Im more upset about the fact that Im now in uncharted waters and anything can happen in the next 6 weeks. My bump was measured yesterday and I was told baby is small and need to go for a growth scan and I have gestational diabetes too. I just want all of this unpleasantness and uncertainty to end. I don't mind the niggles if I knew they were normal but some of the symptoms Im feeling these days Im not familiar with and it scares me to think I might need to call the midwife every 5 minutes or go into early labour :( *feeling sorry for myself today*

No, you're not alone. I am on my second pregnancy and this one has been much harder than my first. I'm 34 weeks and very much looking forward to this baby being born within the next 6 weeks! I can't even fuction anymore!

I wasn't in any rush until recently. I threw my mom a large surprise birthday party when I was 31 weeks and I was on my feet all day and working hard. I ignored my body's protest to sit down and rest the entire day... I went to bed in tears that night.Yeah, bad idea... my body hasn't recovered from it at all even after days of resting. I won't ever make that mistake again.

I'm almost 37 weeks and I am beyond exhausted! I'm in constant pain with contractions in my lower back,  I feel my son drop every day is so painful. I can't sleep anymore. I just want him here already but I'm wanting to wait at least till I'm 38 weeks just so he gets to finish baking and maturing. We will see though cause I'm dilated already and contract almost every day

question: I'm almost 34 weeks and I'm so over being pregnant... I feel guilty about it at times but I've been so miserable dealing with a high risk pregnancy, being on blood thinners, and having gestational diabetes!
title: Am I the only one that is tired of being pregnant?
